thread.title: Exxon’s Canadian Subsidiary Sees Output Gains from High-Cost Oil-Sands
thread.title_full: Exxon’s Canadian Subsidiary Sees Output Gains from High-Cost Oil-Sands - WSJ

author: Chester Dawson
title: Exxon’s Canadian Subsidiary Sees Output Gains from High-Cost Oil-Sands
text:
The top executive at Exxon Mobil Corp.’s Canadian subsidiary on Wednesday said new technology has the potential to more than double production from a series of proposed oil-sands projects, a bullish signal for Canada’s high-cost heavy oil operations even as it faces a slump in crude oil prices and falling investment.
Exxon subsidiary Imperial Oil Ltd. said pilot tests show a nearly 30% increase in production using a modified version of its steam-assisted gravity drainage, or SAGD, technology, which recovers deposits of... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
